page.title: 02BROXBURN AND PUMPHERSTON.
page.content: This area of Central Scotland consists of parts of the villages of Pumpherston, Uphall Station, Uphall and Dechmont and parts of the town of Broxburn. The most spectacular feature of this area is the shale bings around Pumpherston. These Bings are the by-product of the shale oil industry which was once dominant in the area. The towns grew around this once thriving industry and are now well established communities. The surrounding countryside mainly consists of farmland and smallholdings Part of the Union Canal also runs through this area. This once busy canal is now disused as a means of transport but provides recreational activities.
